entries.description: Created .vibe/ workspace memory: nexus.md, task_plan.md, logbook.json, architecture.md
entries.decision: B.L.A.S.T. protocol activated with A.N.T. 3-layer architecture.

entries.description: 5 Discovery Questions answered by user. North Star, integrations, source of truth, payload, and behavior defined.
entries.decision: Project is a couple movie matcher: questions → TMDB recommendations → swipe → match. Stack: Next.js 16.1 + Supabase + TMDB + Vercel. Mobile-first.

entries.description: Defined 9 canonical data schemas in nexus.md: profiles, couples, questions, sessions, user_answers, session_movies, swipes, matches, seen_movies.
decisions: Partner code (6-char) for couple formation instead of email invite — simpler UX.
session_movies caches TMDB data — avoids re-fetching during swipe phase.
match_score (0.0–1.0) computed server-side from both users' answers.
Sessions expire after 24h to prevent stale data.
Swipe choices hidden from partner until both complete — prevents bias.

entries.description: Researched Next.js 16.1 (App Router, Server Components, Server Actions) and Supabase (Auth, RLS, Realtime) documentation.
decisions: Use Next.js App Router with Server Components for data fetching.
Use Server Actions for mutations (swipes, answers, etc.).
Use Supabase RLS to enforce data isolation per couple.
Use Supabase Realtime for partner notifications (answer complete, swipe match).
Supabase trigger auto-creates profile on auth.users INSERT.
Scoring uses geometric mean to ensure movies appeal to BOTH users.
